messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] OT: 50th birthday ideas please??
messages.msgSnippet: Ha! Hey thanks, I ll keep that one in mind! Kristen, who might lose the eulogy and keep the black theme. I asked all the guests to bring him 40 of something.
messages.messageBody:
Ha!

Hey thanks, I'll keep that one in mind!

Kristen, who might lose the eulogy and keep the "black" theme.




I asked all the guests to bring him 40 of something. He
got stuff like 40 screws (not from me - at least not then :-), 40
pennies (from a favorite neighbor child), 40 feet of dental floss, 40
ounces of BBQ sauce, 40 nails, 40 beers, etc.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: OT: 50th birthday ideas please??
messages.msgSnippet: My husband turned 50 this week too!  I had a small party with just our neighborhood group and made prime rib for the first time. (Recipe in Cook s
messages.messageBody:
My husband turned 50 this week too! I had a small party with just
our "neighborhood group" and made prime rib for the first time.
(Recipe in Cook's Illustrated magazine - it was EASY!!!)

But I did have a cool idea (I'm sure I read it somewhere) when he
turned 40. I asked all the guests to bring him 40 of something. He
got stuff like 40 screws (not from me - at least not then :-), 40
pennies (from a favorite neighbor child), 40 feet of dental floss, 40
ounces of BBQ sauce, 40 nails, 40 beers, etc.


It was really fun. Best gift was 40 winks - my friend had taken 40
different pictures of people winking - she said he figured he could
use the rest. . .

Anyway - maybe someone can use that idea. . . it was fun.

Mercedes
lots of math in counting to 40 (or 50)
